org.jchassis.event
Class SimpleEventFilter

java.lang.Object
  org.jchassis.event.SimpleEventFilter
All Implemented Interfaces:
EventFilter
public class SimpleEventFilter
extends java.lang.Object
implements EventFilter

A simple event filter implementation that filters based on an event's data type and role or role prefix.

Copyright © 2003-2005 Sam Stainsby.
Verbatim copying and distribution of this entire generated javadoc document is permitted in any medium, provided this notice is preserved.

Constructor Summary
SimpleEventFilter()
          Creates an "identity" filter — all events pass through.
SimpleEventFilter(boolean allowEvents)
          Creates either an "identity" filter or a "null" filter — either all events or no events pass through.
SimpleEventFilter(java.lang.Class allowedClass)
          Creates a filter that only allows events that have the specified class.
SimpleEventFilter(EventRole allowedRole)
          Creates a filter that only allows events that have the specified role.
SimpleEventFilter(EventRole allowedRole, java.lang.Class allowedClass)
          Creates a filter that only allows events that have the specified class and role.
 
Method Summary
 boolean allowEvent(EventRole eventRole, java.lang.Object eventData)
          Determines whether the specified event with the specified role should be propagated.

          Gets the class of event data that is allowed through this filter.

Constructor Detail

SimpleEventFilter

public SimpleEventFilter(EventRole allowedRole,
                         java.lang.Class allowedClass)
Creates a filter that only allows events that have the specified class and role. This calls this(allowedRole, false, allowedClass).

Parameters:
allowedRole - the role of events to allow through; if null, events with any role are allowed
allowedClass - the class of event data to allow through; subclasses are also allowed; if null, all classes are allowed

SimpleEventFilter

public SimpleEventFilter(EventRole allowedRole)
Creates a filter that only allows events that have the specified role. This calls this(allowedRole, false).

Parameters:
allowedRole - the role of events to allow through; if null, events with any role are allowed

SimpleEventFilter

public SimpleEventFilter(java.lang.Class allowedClass)
Creates a filter that only allows events that have the specified class. This calls this(null, allowedClass).

Parameters:
allowedClass - the class of event data to allow through; subclasses are also allowed; if null, all classes are allowed

SimpleEventFilter

public SimpleEventFilter(boolean allowEvents)
Creates either an "identity" filter or a "null" filter — either all events or no events pass through. This calls this((String) null).

Parameters:
allowEvents - if true, all events are allowed through; otherwise no events are allow through

SimpleEventFilter

public SimpleEventFilter()
Creates an "identity" filter — all events pass through. This calls this(true).

Method Detail

isAllowingEvents

public boolean isAllowingEvents()
Indicated whether this filter is allowing any events through or not.

Returns:
true events are being allowed; otherwise no events are allowed

getAllowedClass

public java.lang.Class getAllowedClass()
Gets the class of event data that is allowed through this filter.

Returns:
the class of events allowed; null indicates that events of any class are allowed

getAllowedRole

public EventRole getAllowedRole()
Gets the role of events that are allowed through this filter.

Returns:
the role of events allowed; null indicates that events with any role are allowed

allowEvent

public boolean allowEvent(EventRole eventRole,
                          java.lang.Object eventData)
Description copied from interface: EventFilter
Determines whether the specified event with the specified role should be propagated.

Specified by:
allowEvent in interface EventFilter
Parameters:
eventRole - the event' role
eventData - the data associated with the event
Returns:
true if the event should be propagated; false otherwise
